definition: Lake Balkhash in southeast Kazakhstan
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou
(onom.) sound of coughing or vomiting

sentences.english: The weather system developed strongly in the Balkhash Lake area.
sentences.chinese: 天气系统在巴尔喀什湖地区强烈发展。

definition: Syr Darya, Central Asian river, flowing from Kyrgiz Republic through Kazakhstan to the Aral sea
Lake Issyk Kul in Kyrgyzstan
Sakhalin
Irtysh River, flowing from southwest Altai in Xinjiang through Kazakhstan and Siberia to the Arctic Ocean
Aral Sea
Talas River, originating in Kyrgyzstan and flowing west into Kazakhstan

Amu Darya, the biggest river of Central Asia, from Pamir to Aral sea, forming the boundary between Afghanistan and Tajikistan then flowing through Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan/formerly called Oxus by Greek and Western writers, and Gihon by medieval Islamic writers
Lake Baikal
Tekes River in southeast Kazakhstan and northwest China, a tributary of the Ili River 伊犁河[Yi1 li2 He2]

Tarim Basin depression in southern Xinjiang

Altai mountain range in Xinjiang and Siberia
